intro: Chrysanthemum pallens, commonly known as the pale chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces numerous small florets arranged in a composite flower head. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. The pale chrysanthemum is also valued for its use in traditional Chinese medicine.
